short_summary: DART-MS Installation & training at Vancouver Drug Analysis Service in Burnaby, BC & Montreal DAS Lab in Longueuil, QC.
description: Supply, deliver, install, and provide training for two DART-MS Ion Sources by April 30th, 2024.
tags: Direct Analysis in Real Time Mass Spectrometry (DART-MS)
full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement

## H4005-235061 - DART-MS Installation

### Tender Details

* **Tender Reference Number**: WS4310926999-Doc4404059731
* **Amendment Number**: 2
* **Solicitation Number**: WS4310926999
* **Publication Date**: 2024-03-12
* **Tender Closing Date**: 2024-04-23T14:00:00 (disabled as tender is expired)
* **Expected Contract Start Date**: Not available
* **Expected Contract End Date**: 2025-03-28

### Procurement Information

* **Procurement Category**: Goods and Services (GD)
* **Procurement Method**: Competitive - Open Bidding
* **Notice Type**: Request for Proposal
* **Selection Criteria**: Highest Combined Rating of Technical Merit and Price

### Trade Agreements

The procurement is subject to the following trade agreements:

* Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
* Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
* Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA)
* Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement

### Regions of Opportunity and Delivery

The procurement is open to bidders in the following regions:

* British Columbia
* Ontario (excluding National Capital Region)
* Quebec (excluding National Capital Region)

### Contracting and User Entity Information

* **Contracting Entity**: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
* **User Entity**: Department of Health (HC)

### Contact Information

* **Name**: Thomas Leboeuf (SPAC/PSPC)
* **Email**: thomas.leboeuf@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
* **Phone**: Not available
* **Fax**: Not available

### Tender Description

Health Canada requires the supply, delivery, installation, and training for two Direct Analysis in Real Time Mass Spectrometry (DART-MS) Ion Sources to be provided at the Vancouver Drug Analysis Service (DAS) Laboratory in Burnaby, British Columbia, and the Montreal DAS Laboratory in Longueuil, Quebec. The tender includes an option for up to one additional unit by March 31, 2026, with a delivery schedule of no later than April 30, 2024. [1](https://discovery.ariba.com
